reviewText: Very very light,
This course has complicated english and very very very difficult quizzes...
I haven't received my certificate. I had completed the course within the first 7 days.
There were some interesting tools but overall the whole module was very boring, lessons seemed endless.

The course material and the way it is taught are excellent. The necessary assignment is tailored well and expect the material revise and research to be done. The research feedbacks  are complete disasters.  After the 4th course at Coursera I realize that it is the weakest point. I have received just a few words, "ok", "n/a" and "good" are among them. No analysis and weak points outlining.  In order to improve it, I propose the tutors to revise the final assignments of those who reached >90 points during the week tests and decrease the pass grade from 70+% to 55%.  There will be an incentive for those who really want to learn.

The course iteslf was interesting and the presenters were well spoken to hold your attention. I don't think that having peer's review your work is the best way about getting appropriate feedback and consistent marking of your work. There was also some issues with the peer assignment actually coming through for review meaning the completion of the course was delayed.
It was interesting i discovered a lot of things. I encourage everybody to apply on coursera’s course.

There was a disconnect between the way the content was presented and the expectations for the final writing assignment. The Real Options tool only got 5 mintues of coverage but we were expected to apply it.
Good course, but I think the previous courses of the specialization are better organized and structured than this one.

I learned a lot about the different approaches to grow a business. I specially paid attention to the challenges to Merges and Acquisitions, which is very common between firms, and also the failure of them. Today I have a different perspective on companies growth, and confirmed someone accountable for growth strategy cant be in "paralysis by analysis", meaning it needs to formulate it very quick, implement with lots of uncertainty but also adjust quickly as the results generate some information or data, a great challenge!
This is a very hands on section of the course, I really enjoyed diving into the growth strategies and analyzing my selected company
real business scenarios for growth and also pitfalls ..excellent and focused approach.

Really enjoyed the course guys - thanks very much for investing the time required to offer this to the masses! The videos were great - brief, succinct lessons to discuss valuable, applicable tools for optimizing growth strategy.Cheers,

At first I didn't see this course as particularly interesting, but with the first week's lectures I understood its approach and I believe it is a very important aspect of business strategy.Overall, the entire specialization gives a wide range of tools to be used in a company or a new venture with spectacular results. I highly recommend any or all of the courses offered in this specialization.

Excellent course. Continue building on the basics of the prior two courses (Business Strategy & Advanced Business Strategy) which is part of the specialization offered. The professors are fantastic and the course material very relevant to those with a focus on picking up the basics of business strategy.
